conclusion: To find the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched, we need to determine the force acting on the projectile and then use that to find the power.
The Lorentz force F acting on the projectile is calculated as F = I * d * B = 0.2 N.
Using Newton's second law, the acceleration of the projectile is determined as a = F / m = 10 m/s^2.
The velocity of the projectile as it exits the rail is calculated using the kinematic equation, resulting in v = sqrt(10) m/s ≈ 3.16 m/s.
The power of the railgun is determined as P = F * v ≈ 0.632 W.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is approximately 0.632 W.
